title: Sales Operations Coordinator
content:
Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is a world-famous brand with offices across the globe. Fender was born in Southern California and has built a worldwide influence beyond the studio and the stage. A Fender is more than an instrument; it’s a cultural symbol that resonates globally.
We are searching for a Sales Operations Co-Ordinator to join our team. Working within the Sales Operations Team, the Sales Operations Coordinator will be responsible for various aspects of Fender EMEA’s Sales tools and processes.  They will be responsible for maintaining essential systems used by the Business Development Managers as well as various parts of the internal AS400 & SAP systems, such as Dealer Price Lists and Agreements.
Essential Functions: 

Maintain relevant data within Fender’s internal AS400 & SAP systems, such as Price Lists and Product Information.
Provide sales materials and support to Sales Teams.
Maintain information within the PIM system and Dealer Portal.
Represent the company in a positive and professional manner at all times.
Ad-hoc projects as directed by the Sales Operations Manager and Sales & Product Operations Director.

This is an indication of the main responsibilities of the role and the Company reserve the right to amend the content of the role at its discretion.
Qualifications:
Essential Skills/Experience

Excellent IT skills and a good working knowledge of online systems.
Effective communication skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to work on own initiative and be self-motivated.
Ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Good attention to detail.
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Good organisational skills.
Results focused.

 
Desirable Skills/Experience

Knowledge and understanding of the musical instrument industry and other musical instrument manufacturers.
Experience using SAP.

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING STATEMENTS CAREFULLY: The information I've provided on this application is accurate to the best of my knowledge and subject to verification. Any misrepresentation or deliberate omission of fact in my application will be justification for refusal to employ me or for termination of my employment by Fender Musical Instruments Corporation. If employed, I shall sign the non-compete/confidentiality agreement, if applicable, in which I will agree to protect Fender Musical Instruments Corporation's confidential information. If employed, I understand that Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is an "at will" employer, in that employment is terminable at the will of the company or me at any time, with or without notice, and for any lawful reason, or no reason. I understand that, if employed, I must at all times comply with Fender Musical Instruments Corporation's standards of work performance and business conduct. Failure to do so can result in my release without notice or severance pay. I authorize Fender Musical Instruments Corporation to obtain information about me from my previous employers and schools.
